newsitem.title: UK: NWE gasoline up $1 despite sluggish U.S. support.
newsitem.headline: NWE gasoline up $1 despite sluggish U.S. support.

text.p: NWE gasoline edged up $1 a tonne on Monday but activity was slow.
Some dealers still expect support from the United States over the next few days but the NYMEX was only about 75 cents a tonne firmer by late afternoon in London.
Rotterdam barges traded at $184.50 fob Antwerp for premium unleaded and $178 fob for regular. July swaps traded at $186 and $185.50 while August talked $1 a tonne lower.
Low octane, regular grades remain $6.50 below premium despite demand from Nigeria for 21 cargoes over the next three months.
"I would have expected a stronger reaction," said one trader.
